item.title: Bridge returned error 500! (18706)
item.content:encoded:
blm5280 - Instagram Bridge was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `Unable to find username in search result.`
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Instagram&context=Username&u=blm5280&media_type=all&direct_links=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

item.title: This is a free event, y‚Äôall! Registration now open! As we are...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

This is a free event, y‚Äôall! Registration now open!

As we are all facing ongoing adversity, we are learning to navigate our struggles in innovative ways. Join our conversation with Common, Grammy and Academy Award winning artist and activist, and Dr. Apryl Alexander, prominent psychologist, as they discuss the many paths we can create to cope and come together with our communities to begin healing.
https://rsvp.du.edu/‚Ä¶/7b410520-f1fa-43ef-8cb2-353ce‚Ä¶/summary

item.title: *We are not the organizers of this event; it is community-led* ...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

*We are not the organizers of this event; it is community-led*
#StopAsianHate #StopAAPIHate #AAPI #EndWhiteSupremacy #Solidarity

Img text: Candlelight Vigil & Night of Remembrance
to honor the lives taken and affected by anti-Asian violence

...

The vigil will be held at the site of Denver‚Äôs Chinatown, that flourished until 1880, when it was destroyed violently by a racist mob. One man was killed and Chinatown never fully recovered. Chinatown was used as a scapegoat for many of Denver‚Äôs issues; the name ‚ÄúHop Alley‚Äù was derived from false accusations of opium overuse, far more common among white residents of Denver. Solidarity with all Asian relatives near and abroad! End white supremacy in all its forms!
Saturday, March 20th, 6pm
southeast corner of 20th and Blake St.

See More
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: ***ACTION ALERT*** In solidarity with FrontLine Farming, we need...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

***ACTION ALERT***

In solidarity with FrontLine Farming, we need your help ensuring that Colorado agricultural workers get the basic rights already afforded other workers in the state through this bill: Concerning Agricultural Workers Rights SB21-087.

For almost a century, agricultural workers have been excluded from many of this country‚Äôs most important and hard-fought labor protections, including the right to organize, the right to overtime pay, and in the case of thousands... of Colorado farmworkers, the right to minimum wage. The origins of these exclusions, which go back decades, are explicitly racist--originally part of an effort to exclude Black workers from the New Deal‚Äôs most important labor protections. Especially now, after a year in which farmworkers have suffered disproportionately from the pandemic and toiled in wildfires and extreme heat to bring food to our tables, it is essential that we close these anachronistic gaps and provide basic protections and dignity to some of the State‚Äôs most vulnerable workers.

Use this form to contact Colorado Senators TODAY BEFORE the 1pm MST committee hearing: https://www.projectprotectfoodsystems.org/sb-21-087

See MoreWe need your help ensuring that Colorado agricultural workers get the basic rights already afforded other workers in the state through this bill: Concerning Agricultural Workers Rights SB21-087.

projectprotectfoodsystems.org

SB 21- 087 | PROJECT PROTECT

We need your help ensuring that Colorado agricultural workers get the basic rights already afforded other workers in the state through this bill: Concerning Agricultural Workers Rights SB21-087.We need your help ensuring that Colorado agricultural workers get the basic rights already afforded other workers in the state through this bill: Concerning Agricultural Workers Rights SB21-087.

item.title: We are holding space for our AAPI family. #StopAsianHate Image...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

We are holding space for our AAPI family.
#StopAsianHate

Image Description: @asiansformentalhealth has shared an orange text box that reads, ‚ÄúDear AAPI family, As you hear the news of the attacks in Atlanta, please sit down. Please give your weary soul time to breathe abs catch up. Please turn off your phones and turn inward toward those you love. Please grieve, cry, wail, and exhale. Give your body the space to acknowledge the pain that you have been carrying for so long.‚Äù
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: #StopAsianHate All love and solidarity to our #AAPI siblings....
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

#StopAsianHate
All love and solidarity to our #AAPI siblings.
As the traumatic stories and videos circulate please give yourself space to grieve and just breathe.

https://www.gofundme.com/c/act/stop-aapi-hate

...

‚ÄúWe must act now. A horrific and heartbreaking surge in violence against Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders (#AAPI) is happening across the US. Together, it is our responsibility to condemn hate and create lasting social change. GoFundMe stands with the AAPI community and remains committed to rectifying the racial inequalities in our society. Support the AAPI Community Fund to uplift and protect Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders.‚Äù

See MoreWe must unite to stop Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) hate. Donate to and share fundraisers actively uplifting AAPI communities.

gofundme.com

Stop Asian Hate: What You Can Do To Make a Difference

item.title: Amy E. Brown: "Toxic masculinity is real and it‚Äôs...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Amy E. Brown: "Toxic masculinity is real and it‚Äôs dangerous. Like white supremacy, it‚Äôs not the fish in the tank but the water around them. Toxic masculinity can bleed into movements in very dangerous ways. I‚Äôve experienced that and that‚Äôs why there is a BLM 5280, because of the ways the patriarchy and white supremacy made Black women and the queer community feel unsafe in activist spaces.

I can only speak for Black women. I can‚Äôt speak for my Indigenous, Latinx, and Asian s...isters. But Black women sit at this intersection of white supremacy and heteronormative patriarchy. Anything that hits a black man once is going to hit us twice. Anything that hits a white woman once is going to hit us five times because we‚Äôre doubly impacted. A white friend of mine told me she wished Black people didn‚Äôt have to do any of this and I should be able to be at home enjoying my life. But my life depends on this work and we can‚Äôt leave these movements for other people to lead. Historically, when we‚Äôve left being in charge to cis-hetero men or allies it‚Äôs turned into a dumpster fire that has often been harmful. It‚Äôs our lives that depend on this work and women are impacted by every change that is and isn‚Äôt made."

See MoreResearch shows that women are better equipped to lead social justice movements. Three Colorado organizers tell us why they think it's true.

msmayhem.com

The women leading social justice movements‚Äîand the forces holding them back - Ms. Mayhem

Research shows that women are better equipped to lead social justice movements. Three Colorado organizers tell us why they think it's true.Research shows that women are better equipped to lead social justice movements. Three Colorado organizers tell us why they think it's true.

item.title: #MutualAid #Reparations
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

#MutualAid #Reparations

Kandace Montgomery

Hey community, friends, and networksüíú

As many of you know, I‚Äôve been the main caretaker for my dad for the past several years as he deals with late stage diabet...es, kidney, and heart disease. In February he was hospitalized and almost lost his leg due to a bone infection. Now, he‚Äôs home but needs daily care to support him as he navigates life in a wheelchair until we are able to fully heal his feet & legs. I‚Äôve been able to hire a care giver to come daily but need support to help pay for it. Please share the graphic, fundraiser, and donate if you can ‚ú®

See More
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280‚Äôs Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
